conclusion: Understand the geometry and properties of the parabolic reflector and hemispherical lens
The height of the car headlights from the horizontal ground is 92.8 cm
Determine the focal length of the parabolic reflector using the height of the car headlights
Relationship between height and focal length of a parabolic reflector: h = f^2 / 4R
The focal length f can be found using the properties of the parabola
Assume the height is directly related to the focal length
Determine the radius R of the hemispherical lens using properties of the lens and parabola
Light enters the lens perpendicular to the vertical diameter MN and is refracted according to Snell's law
Refractive index of the lens is n = 4/3
Calculate the length of the transparent part of the lens using the arc length formula L = Rθ
The angle θ can be determined using the properties of the lens and parabola
Use angle of incidence and angle of refraction to find the length of the arc
